comments.value:
We have a requirement to embed a web form as an iframe into a page on our website. Work in progress here: http://jupiter.ukdatapoint.com/wl-locog/controller.web?method=addVenueEvent

This is a web form which will allow members of the public to upload events to the Global Datapoint system, which we can review and ultimately publish via the events database. It will fit within the (coming soon) Local Leaders section of the website (in Get Involved), which will explain the campaign (getting members of the public to organise events to celebrate the Games).

We need the page with the iframe to go live on 1 December (hard deadline). We should have the final, London 2012-branded web form by 15 November, to give us time to test.

I'm hoping that's straightforward and that you have enough notice to do that. Please can you advise though on the dimensions we require for the iframe - it needs to fit within a normal content page with left-hand nav?

Thanks!

Morag

Morag Reavley
Senior New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London

Reception: 020 32012 000

comments.value:
At some point in the future it may be useful to give Erin the ability to set DFP tags on a per page basis using a meta data field in the CMS.

This will save the need for us to hard code exceptions in the back end tag generation code (a current example the the BP arts page).

There is no immediate need for this, but we should probably revisit what would be required and schedule a time to do it once the current tranche of work is out of the way, so it's there when it;s needed in future.

This work has now been completed,

If you enter a tag into the 'doubleclick' box under metadata within the page editor, that tag will override the tag generated by default.  

In preview the tag will display "Custom tag:" as opposed to just "Tag:" (which is the how the auto-generated tags appear)

Currently what ever you type in is passed to the double click tag *exactly* as is, if you would prefer we can automatically prepend "pgs_" to the start of whatever you enter in the 'doubleclick' field let us know and we can easily change.

One last thing, try not to use this on huge swathes of pages, if you want a different tag (say for pages mentioning culture) we will almost certainly  be able to automate this based on the tags or themes already assigned to the page or other information. Where I expect this feature is most useful is where a single article must only have a BT advert, or when a single page in a larger section needs to be singled out for special treatment.

Any issues or queries, let me know..

Jamie

comments.value:
Hi all, 

Just had a meeting with the Track Cycling team ahead of the test event's tickets on sale date next month. 

The changes to the Cycling London Prepares Series site have unfortunately come to us really late - would it be possible for you to schedule in these changes to be made the next fortnight.? ~Sorry, I know it's a late shout. 

The changes the Cycing team have requested are:

An adjustment to the banner at the top page (similar to that on the BMX text event page - http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/bmx/index.html). The alternative here is to remove the London Prepares Series logo top right and replace that with a UCI World Cup banner which will be exactly the same size as the existing LPS one. Would this be possible to do?

The second change is the logos on the footer. UCI anticipate that they will have 7 logos to pop across the bottom. Would it be possible to remove the blue and pink Preparies Series logo and spread the logos across the footer? 

If you could provide us with potential costs and timings to do these changes (if they are possible) that would be great. We require them within the next two weeks but as soon as possible would be even better. 

Thanks very much and apologies again for the late notice. 

Antonia

Marking as high. Will check with Tom re: other priorities, but this should be doable. 

Adjustment to banner: it is likely to be easier to give you a BMX-like banner than to replace the LPS logo, which in any case the only way to navigate back to the front of the site.

Removing the footer background image: shouldn't be a problem, I think.

Unless I have missed something, this is looks like 2-3 hours to code and test, although I wouldn't be surprised if there were a bit of toing and froing with the new images, so perhaps 0.5 days is a sensible estimate.

Could you get the banner and sponsor logos prepared, so that we can check that the proposed tweaks will work?

Thanks Danny. 

Do you have the dimensions of the BMX banner to hand at all please? We'll try and get something made up to that size ASAP, with approval from the cycling guys. 

Sponsor logos - I'll get these together for you too. 

Thanks

630x98px

http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/images/headlines/bmx-section-logo.gif

Hi Danny, 

Please see attached the approved 630x98 banner for the homepage of the Track Cycling test event. 

It's in PSD format - is that okay for you to work with? The Logos will be along shortly. 

Thank you

Antonia

Hi Danny, 

Track have confirmed the logos they would like to appear on the footer of the website as follows:

Samsung  (the one in the oval)
Tissot
Santini
Sky
Panasonic
UCI
UK Sport
British Cycling

Attached is the logos they sent over to me. Do you have the others that aren't in the folder to hand?

Thank you

Antonia

Hi Danny, 

Do you have a day in the next couple of weeks in which these amends are scheduled for? Just need to let the Track team know when they are likely to be in place for ticket on sale on the 17th. 

Thank you

Antonia

Antonia, this is marked a high priority for this week, but that effectively means not before this time next week. Please hassle me again on Monday and I will make sure it is done in the first half of next week.

Hi Danny, 

Hassling you as requested...I've had a couple of additional requests through from the test event teams for another coupld of logos to be added. This shouldn't increase the workload too much, but just to confirm our requirements are as follows:

A 630x98 banner to be added to the homepage of the Track Cycling test event. 
8 logos to be added to the bottom of the UCI track cycling test event website:
Samsung (the one in the oval) 
Tissot 
Santini 
Sky 
Panasonic 
UCI 
UK Sport 
British Cycling

**British Swimming logo to be added to the footer of the Swimming test event website (logo attached)
**Gymnova logo to be added to the footer of the Artistic Gymnastics test event website (logo attached)

I hope this is okay. Please let me know if you require any further info. 

Thanks

Antonia

Sorry Danny, one more thing...

The Test Event team have also requested that we change the LPS logo from TM to R where possible across the sites. 

I've attached a jpeg and eps file of the 'R' one for you. I think we only need to look at getting this on the main site, Track cycling, Artistic Gymnastics and Diving sites for now. 

**please note, the British Swimming logo needs to go on the Diving site, not swimming as I've incorrectly stated above... apologies!
Antonia, we are looking at this today.
Lars, over to you.

Hi Antonia, we have started on this, but there is one thing that it would be very helpful if you could get help with on your side. Is there anyone over there who could take the file "UCI logos for site footer.zip" that you sent us a couple of weeks ago and extract the relevant images for us appropriately sized and ready to upload? Many thanks.

Danny ~ please see my comments:

The banner for trackcycling is now in place, and also the TM is changed to an R but for all pages, is this ok?

Regarding the banners, it would be best to get a signed off preview/design for this so i can use the size and order of the
banners and implement them this way. 

Mr.L

I've resized these up for you - hope they're suitable.

Please note, the order below has been requested as to how they should all appear from left to right with click throughs - if this is possible? I hope this is okay:

The gymnastics team have requested we add two logos to the Artistic Gymnastics footer if possible please, with the following links:

1) Gymnova (http://www.gymnova.com/en/)

subject: Track Cycling Test Event Website amends
description:
Hi all, 

Just had a meeting with the Track Cycling team ahead of the test event's tickets on sale date next month. 

The changes to the Cycling London Prepares Series site have unfortunately come to us really late - would it be possible for you to schedule in these changes to be made the next fortnight.? ~Sorry, I know it's a late shout. 

The changes the Cycing team have requested are:

An adjustment to the banner at the top page (similar to that on the BMX text event page - http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/bmx/index.html). The alternative here is to remove the London Prepares Series logo top right and replace that with a UCI World Cup banner which will be exactly the same size as the existing LPS one. Would this be possible to do?

The second change is the logos on the footer. UCI anticipate that they will have 7 logos to pop across the bottom. Would it be possible to remove the blue and pink Preparies Series logo and spread the logos across the footer? 

If you could provide us with potential costs and timings to do these changes (if they are possible) that would be great. We require them within the next two weeks but as soon as possible would be even better. 

Thanks very much and apologies again for the late notice. 

Antonia

Hi,

We're trying to change the title on a French-language news story on the London 2012 website but are being prevented from doing so by an apparent character limit.

The story in question is here https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/fr/news/2011/09/les-chefs-de-mission-se-rendent-a-londres-pour-assister-a-une-reunion-d-info.php

The current title is  Les Chefs de mission se rendent à Londres pour assister à une réunion d'information sur les Jeux Paralympiques

We want to change it to  Les chefs de mission se rendent à Londres pour assister à une réunion d'information sur les Jeux Paralympiques
However, when we attempted to do so the following message appeared...

Value too large for column "KADMIN"."ITEM$"."DISPLAY_NAME" (actual: 83, maximum: 80) at "KADMIN.K$ITEM", line 1156 at line 1

Presumably this message pops up anytime you exceed the character limit, which seems straightforward. However, I'm a bit confused here as I'm not actually looking to change the character limit, so wonder how we were able to save it with 83 characters in the first place if there is an 80 character limit.

Does this character limit apply only to manual titles we create? i.e. as this is a returned translation, does it somehow bypass the standard character limit rules?

Thanks

Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator

comments.value:
4th January 2011 10:34:21 GMT / Jamie -> Russ / Morag

We have noticed an issue with the load balancer and HTTPS connections resulting in problems with user sessions and in turn login/registrations.

It seems that https connections aren't sticky.

What is going wrong?

The load balancer only seems to be maintaining 'sticky' sessions (ie. sending the user back the same server) if the connection is a http one and not if it is a https one (which the login/register page is).

This can be seen by visiting this page, the first time a session cookie is set, but the user isn't returned to the same server on subsequent requests.
https://www.london2012.com/stest.php

With a http connection you are always returned to the same server.
https://www.london2012.com/stest.php

---

4th January 2011 10:34:21 GMT / Russ -> Jamie

Hi there Jamie/Morag

I think that this is a known issue with the London2012 site - have had my guys here try to replicate the issue - if you sign into 2012 then move to another page it seems to forget that you have signed in.

Have spoken to BT about this - they have asked me to coinfirm that we want https sessions to be sticky and http sessions to be stateless. They may be able to make some changes on this.

Do you know how we currently do sticky sessions? is it based on session cookie?
If so then ... the load balancer won't be able to make sessions sticky.
The only (realistic) way to enable sticky sessions with https is by IP address.
  http://wiki.metawerx.net/wiki/StickySessions

Thoughts:

- change the way https / http works so that you always get bounced back to http for non https pages (actually this won't guarantee a fix, but may be worth doing anyway).
- set the sessionID cookie each time? not sure this is the issue though (but looks liek we may need to check we are doing this) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/441496/session-lost-when-switching-from-http-to-https-in-php
- use query string based cookies for login pages? 

Surely this is a common requirement?
question for kieran, I think. Assigned to you.

When I spoke to Akamai the other day, they said that they store their own london2012.com cert, which they then use to inspect the contents of the https requests, before forwarding to the load-balancer.

It would be good it the load-balancer could do a similar thing. It sounds like a common requirement for any kind of non-trivial load-balancer. Obviously, I can see the downside of having to attend 47 bridge calls in order to discuss/commission this but ... it would seem to me to be the correct way to do it.

(unless - of course - /Akamai/ can be configured to be the load-balancer, and we cut out the BT one?)

(assigned back to jamie for comments)

Bouncing this back, but only to say we should have a chat about this one as I noticed they we're questioning the lack of blog comments (which I can't help but think is related, you only have a 1 in 6 chance to login/comment !)

Danny was just asking where we we're with this, I replied that although I raised it last year and this year, tight now I (personal) don't want to prod too hard right now, for fear of getting sucked into a BT/ITS void.

But we do need to get it fixed at some point, as far as I can tell is it's a BT or an Akamai issue.

(unless we recoded large chunks of our login system)

--

Sticky Sessions and HTTPS

Sticky sessions will not work with HTTPS (SSL) if the server ID is based on the HTTP session. This is because the contents of the requests cannot be investigated due to the encryption. In this case, there are 3 options:

	▪	Web server proxies. An initial web server decodes the SSL requests, and forwards the request onto one of the servers in the cluster. Fairly simple to set up, but causes increased load on the proxy. Also the proxy is a single point of failure, which is more likely to fail considering the amount of work it has to perform.
	
--> Akamai ?

▪	Hardware SSL decoders. Hardware in the router or load balancer that is capable of decoding the HTTPS requests, and determining the session information stored in them. These are fast and less likely to fail than a web server proxy, but often more difficult to set up and with pricing based on their power.

--> BT ?

	▪	IP address-based server allocation. All requests from a given IP address or range are sent to the same server. This is by far the easiest and cheapest method, and allows the router or load-balancer to do all the work. However, their may be more chance of an unevenly distributed load with this method if most of the load comes from a single IP/range. For example, all requests are coming from the same university, will all be sent to the same server.

--> Incompatible with Akamai?

Frustratingly, Akamai /can/ unravel the https requests. BUT it's of no help, because all they can then do is forward to the load balancer (which - as you say /doesn't/ unravel the requests).
The load balancer is afaics BY FAR the best way of doing it.
I wonder whether we should suggest sending one of our technical team to go and work with ITS for a couple of days in order to investigate the feasibility and get this set up? I suggest me.
Do either of you object if I bring this up again with ITS?
assigning back to you :)

Sorry Wahome, that's not what it is.
The GDP search api appears to somewhat randomly return either 15, 18 or 1 result!
I have a local script that reproduces it by making repeated calls to
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011
sometimes it returns 15 results, sometimes 18, and sometimes 1 result.
Interestingly, when it returns 1 result, that result is titleId=9000961547 which doesn't even exist in the feed from GDP (hence the frontend /saying/ 1 result, but displaying none).
Please can the following be forwarded to GDP?

===
The GDP search api appears to somewhat randomly return either 15, 18 or 1 result!
I have a local script that reproduces it by making repeated calls to
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011
sometimes it returns 15 results, sometimes 18, and sometimes 1 result.
Interestingly, when it returns 1 result, that result is titleId=9000961547 which doesn't even exist in the feed from GDP (hence the frontend /saying/ 1 result, but displaying none).
The test script I am running is the following which performs 20 requests, and write the responses to files named x1...x20:

#!/bin/bash
for i in {1..20}; do
  wget  -q -O x$i 'http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011'
  echo -n "x${i}. "
  perl -n -e '/totalevents="(.*?)"/; print "Len=$1\n";' x$i
done

Sample output as follows:
x1. Len=18
x2. Len=1
x3. Len=15
x4. Len=18
x5. Len=1
x6. Len=18
x7. Len=18
x8. Len=18
x9. Len=15
x10. Len=1
x11. Len=15
x12. Len=1
x13. Len=18
x14. Len=15
x15. Len=1
x16. Len=15
x17. Len=1
x18. Len=15
x19. Len=18
x20. Len=1

I think you're using EC2; I'm wondering whether there is one or more stale instance or an instance looking at old data (or something!).

Incidentally, I just tried again, and got sensible results (Len=18, 20 times) so I thought maybe someone had fixed it. However I've just tried again and got the above results.

===
Will flag this now with Zeeshan.

Thanks Kieran. Morag - this is definitely one to bring up in the GDP
meeting today.

>

comments.value:
Hello

We have a requirement to put together an online application process for our Young Games Makers programme - for young people 16-17 who aren't old enough to be full Games Makers.

Attached is a spec for the form - please could you review? We need a cost estimate and time plan. The form would be required for September.

Happy to discuss on the phone but wanted to give you an oversight of the scope first.

Thanks!

Morag

<hr width="100%">
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 
          
This E-mail is confidential.  If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return
E-mail.
             
Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.
                                     
Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">
High.

Hi Morag,

Just been looking over this, do you have an idea of [essential] scope / budget?

The reason I ask is on one hand we could slightly shoehorn it to be a basic form, with 2 or 3 extra questions dependent on the role (or url) and a basic CSV export, with all filtering done offline in Excel.

At the other end we could look at building something much nicer and tab based with multiple pages and some backend tools to handle the filtering.

It we we're fulfil all the business requirements to the line, it would probably be more the latter, but obviously with that come increased costs.

- What questions vary on role is it just Q1 and Q2 or could these also vary in number? also will the type always be a free text box?
- Other than the role specific question above, I can't see any fields that depend on the answers to previous fields, but can I just check this is correct?
- Can we assume that the fields will be fixed / agreed and will not change post us starting work? or that if they are you are prepared for possibly significant additional costs / delays. If we are aware before speccing the work that text may change then we can look making this process more manageable, but obviously it will cost more to build that flexibility into the system.

In terms of backend screens / reporting it may be easier to talk though this on the phone.

I'm around all day so when ever is good for you, feel free to call.

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie!

I am asking my colleague Jessica to provide answers to the questions below as I am on leave this week.

Jess, please can you review the below and send Jamie your thoughts, including budget?

Thank you!

Morag

Hello there

Can we catch up on this? My colleague Jess sent through some responses to this while I was away so it would be good to get a sense from you of cost / time requirements.

Many thanks!

Morag

Lets catch up tomorrow, around all day so when ever is good for you.

* when you say "sent through some responses" I assume you mean to you, I not sure we received anything, if we did my apologies as it wasn't forwarded onto me.

Hello

This is what Jess sent on 28 June – sorry it didn’t get to you!

Am in training most of today but will try to give you a call around lunchtime or post 5!

Many thanks

Morag

Hi there

Morag has asked me to respond in her absence and as the original request came from me, it would seem to make sense ;)

I have looked down the email trail below and hope I have pulled out the questions for which you require answers.

- What questions vary on role is it just Q1 and Q2 or could these also vary in number? No always just one and two, maybe just one sometime if the sport doesn’t want to add another question. also will the type always be a free text box? Yes
- Other than the role specific question above, I can't see any fields that depend on the answers to previous fields, but can I just check this is correct? Yes – depending on role you select this determines which questions you get for 1 and/or two but this is the only dependent field.
- Can we assume that the fields will be fixed / agreed and will not change post us starting work? or that if they are you are prepared for possibly significant additional costs / delays. If we are aware before speccing the work that text may change then we can look making this process more manageable, but obviously it will cost more to build that flexibility into the system. – no once we are live they will be fixed

Regarding the backend, obviously the easier it is to use the better. My main requirement will be to be able to print off the applications to take to interview (so all the information is easy to read in the interview) and to do analysis to make sure an organisation hasn’t applied more than once for the same role, report on the number of roles they have applied for, look at the number of applications per role. Other solutions we are evaluating are cheap but have quite basic backend functionality e.g. using adobe forms. It would be great if you could cost with a csv backend but also something a bit more sophisticated with tabs.
Do you know how long it will take you to get a view on costs, I am really keen to make a decision by the end of the week as I know we are running short of time.

If it is easier to chat about any of these requirements please do not hesitate to call me on 02032012656.

Thanks
Jess

Speak to you post 5

Enjoy the training :)

Jamie

Hi Morag,

Just wanted to pick this back up, I know we had 90% of a conversation on it but kind of forgot if I was waiting on any info back from yourself or Jess or if you we're waiting on me.

Should I go ahead and create a proposal based on your requirements and our understanding of how we would implement them, with that level of time/budget? We estimated 8-10 days, when we did a rough breakdown of the work internally.

thanks

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie.

Please could you provide a quote for the internal client? She wants a documented quote before she can authorise go-ahead. Could you do as you suggest and create a proposal with the time/budget associated?

Many thanks!

Morag

Hi Morag,

Attached are costs / a quote for this work, 

I've had a second look at the requirements and it is a significantly more complex form that I first realised. Given that in the past forms of this complexity have required a fair amount of to-ing and fro-ing and testing. I have explicitly added on 2 days for project management. 

I do realise this quote is higher than the ball park I estimated last week and that the allocated budget for this piece of work is not significant. 

Do let Danny or I know if you think our costs fall way outside budget and we could possibly look at ways to de-scope the work; although I have to be honest it's not immediately obvious what we could cut out to significantly reduce costs.

Jamie
Thanks, Jamie. I think these costs look fine. Showing client now – will let you know asap but I’m sure we’ll need you to go ahead...
Morag, do we have deadline for this one?

Update on this: the client has come back with a query as to the feasibilty of extending the original form somewhat. The suggested revised structure is attached. The basic change is inclusion of a range of personal identification information within each of the two Team Leader sections (involving document ID, addresses, D&I data, emergency contact details). This makes each of those two sections substantially longer. 

Please don't spend too long looking at this but can you advise:
1. Is the additional scope feasible within the timeframe of mid September
2. Cost impact (roughly)

My feeling is that we say no to this request and say we need to stick to the original scope, but I did say I would discuss it with you.

I also have some questions around the layout of this form - are you envisaging it as one form or four pages? Do we need css creating for this? 

Please can we have a quick catch up on this today? I am also planning to hand this over to Kavita to lead on from our end, so would like to get her up to speed on it.

Thanks!

Hi Morag,

That looks like a substantially larger / more complex form than before, more than just extra fields there is also the added project management workload of making sure we have all the relevant values for each drop down and/or reg-ex's for checking the format of certain fields and slightly more extensive testing.

It's probably another 2/3 days development and an extra day of project management (but I haven't looked *that* closely)

As you mention, we were expecting this to live on one page but this size of the (new) form would be more suited to a 4 page, 4 step form with the ability to save at any stage (funnily enough I am having deja-vu re. Ceremonies; in that if from the outset we had knew the form was going to get more complex, much like Ceremonies, we may have suggested a different route / approach; indeed as we have only just started on this piece of work that is still an option; I will discuss internally). 

Much as I don't like to turn work down. I do wonder if (we can't go down the Rails route) it is better to just say no now in order to stem any further feature creep on a piece of work that is already fairly tight on timescale and already a large single page form. The biggest danger / risk / problem with all these data capture projects is flux or creep around the fields that need to be captured (inevitable to some extent, as more people are aware of the project and want the form to capture data pertinent to them, but equally a risk in terms of regression and errors creeping in / deadlines being missed).

That said we haven't gone so far that it would be a massive disruption to add the extra fields at this stage, although I would question whether you can have a form this long on one page without a 'save' option and therefore it may be worth quickly deciding if we would be better off re-scoping the project as a Rails app with a 4 stage / page form, that can be saved at any stage (although lack of lead time - to allow BTS to agree to us using a hosted Rails server - rather than development time is probably the biggest hurdle in a late change in architecture/approach; )

Can I also check the client is OK with this just living on a standard Games maker template, we haven't costed for any kind of complex design work above the standard form layout and page look and feel. We were thinking along the lines of the accessible volunteer form.

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie.

My feeling is that we say ‘no’ to any form amplification, for the reasons of a) time b) added complexity to the form c) the requirement to have to save the form (which I think would be key, given there are two people involved here).

Page design – I think the basic GM form is fine. If we did something more designed we would use a separate budget and could use a separate designer for page layout, but I think the issue is time. I’m assuming there isn’t time to get a third party to do any html production (when would you need it for)?

Morag
Due: september 22.
See attached.
Meeting on Tuesday at 9am to review the above, mock ups and a couple of minor changes around data drop downs.

Wording for the application form introduction (main landing page) :
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Thank you for choosing to apply to the Young Games Maker programme.  Please ensure that you have read all the information on the website before submitting your application.  You will be asked to apply for a specific role, at a specific venue during either the Olympic or Paralympic Games. The required skills and experience and the size of the team will vary based on the role you are applying for.  You may only make one application per role.

Hi Kavita, 

I'm not sure whether you recall, but there was a pivotal issue raised about the apostrophes appearing in every field.
The reason the apostrophe was put in there was to address this precise issue (telephone numbers being treated as integers when - in fact - they should be strings). However, the "apostrophe fix" appears (given the issue you raised) not to work in "SharePoint".

I'm afraid I don't have any experience of SharePoint, but I would suggest that it might be an idea to do something approximating:

 1. Select the entire column containing the telephone numbers.
 2. Find the menu item, or control button that that allows you to specify the "display format" (possibly known as "field format").
 3. Select a display format of "text", or "unformatted", or "raw text" / other. Basically you're looking for a format that ISN'T a number type.

The problem incidentally is that spreadsheet software treats fields as numbers by default. This means that the following issues arise when displaying fields containing telephone numbers:
 1. Leading "0"s are omitted (as they're redundant when displaying numbers).
 2. When the field reaches a certain length (i.e. over about 10 digits) numbers get displayed in scientific notation (e.g. 2.5234+E11).
You don't want either of these behaviours for telephone numbers, so you need to tell SharePojnt that these fields are NOT numbers.

If you have any questions, please ask, but bear in mind that I don't have a copy of SharePoint so I can't answer SharePoint-related questions with any authority!

I hope this helps,

Kind regards,

Kieran

However, for the new version of the template that I've created at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php but haven't published yet, we'd like to pull in two different images instead (eg. .../mascot3.jpg and .../mascot4.jpg ?). Can this be altered in the code fairly easily?




2)      We would like the Facebook and Twitter social buttons in the breadcrumb on the new page at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php to act as shares rather than subscriptions. This would mean:


-          changing the Twitter 'follow' button to a 'tweet' button (which pre-populates a tweet linking back to the page). The current link to @London2012 that sits next to the 'follow' button could be replaced by a counter reflecting how many times the new 'tweet' button has been used.



-          Changing the function of the 'Like' button to 'share' of the link on the user's Facebook wall. The counter for this button will need to be reset to reflect the number of times the page has been shared



-          The +1 button can stay the same as it already serves the purpose we want.

Update:

Images of the correct proportions are now placed here: http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/mascotsong1.gif and here http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/mascotsong2.gif. They'll need to link respectively to http://l2012.cm/nmG1pU and http://mascot-games.london2012.com/#/games please.

It's just struck my that I can't check these look ok on the page until you make the changes to http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php so that it pulls in the images above instead of the ones it currently pulls in. Will give you a shout first thing Monday

The carousel images are now editable on the mascots splash template.

Changing the twitter and facebook links is much harder as these are generic components used by all pages. It would require significant re-working the mascots splash template or of the component.

K, thanks Danny, will check ASAP this afternoon

Ta also for info re: social links. Have to check but think I know the answer, do you think there’s any room for the social button changes to be implemented before the end of tomorrow?

Finn, could you double-check with Tom re: the social links? There may be a wider issue here if there are likely to be several instances of different social links on different parts of the site. Instead of hacking up something as a one-off it might be worth looking at ways we could make it easy to change these links on different pages in future (although I haven't really thought seriously about how yet!).

Will do, I think it’s ok for now though Dan. Definitely worth me giving it some consideration if we get other one off campaigns where we’d like to consider applying those changes, but it’s understandable we won’t be able to sort it in time for this one.

Ta for the timeliness with all the other stuff here, appreciate it.
